1141.content:
Frank sat in a chair at his home as he looked at the another man, one who had a digital camcorder.

"Just tell us your story," the man said.

Frank took a sip of water. "Alright, but you'd best listen carefully, for this is the whole truth, my story."

The cameraman nodded. "Go on."

"My name's Frank West. I broke the story on Willamette Colorado, and was infected during the process. I won't say if I was at the Las Vegas Outbreak, or any of the other Outbreak Sites, but let me get one thing straight- I was at the Fortune City incident. Now, I didn't break the story there, Chuck Greene did that- he even helped me out at the Phenotran facility, exposing what's been going on there, and what they actually make the Zombrex with, and that's why I've been helping to try and clear Chuck's name."

Frank's watch starts to beep. "One moment- time for that damn shot again."

He takes out what looks to be an EpiPen, and jabs it into his neck. "That's better," Frank said as he rubbed the injection site. "I hate taking these things, especially considering what goes into making them. I wish the Cure was real, and readily available, but my one friend, who knows how to make it, is being held captive by the company that makes this stuff. Damn how I wish I could nail all of them to the wall."

"So I've heard," said the cameraman.

"As for my story," said Frank. "I was sent to....
1141.title: Frank starts telling his story

12.content:
Chuck Greene loved racing his motorcycle and winning races and trophies, and money. He loved being a husband to his wife, and a father to his daughter, Katey, even more.

Chuck might have heard about what happened in Willamette, but he never imagined that zombies would interfere in his life, until one fateful day when an outbreak occurred in Las Vegas. His wife became one of the undead, and his daughter was bitten by her. Thankfully, Chuck was able to stop the infection from advancing in Katey, but now he needs to purchase Zombex, a highly expensive drug, to keep it in check.

In which Outbreak is Chuck trying to get Zombrex for Katey?

PS. Chuck may meet up with Frank West during Las Vegas Outbreak, but not Still Creek or during the Fortune City Outbreak.

1352.content: Chris Boone ran as fast as he could into a nearby guitar store and grabbed one of the many finely tuned instruments inside. An electric guitar made a good makeshift weapon after all, of course, most anything was a good weapon when facing a mass of slow moving undead. It had been only a few days since he had been forced to flee his own home to escape the invading mass of zombies. Luckily, the local mall had provided a safe haven... at least at first. Now it was a fight just to survive every few minutes against the growing numbers of walking corpses and even a few crazed humans. Chris bludgeoned a nearby zombiefied mall security guard as he reached out for him and began clearing a path through the descending horde of zombies. The heavily damaged guitar snapped in two just as Chris brought it down on the head of an elderly woman who had tried to block his escape route. With an opening Chris ran past the zombies that were closing the gap and made his way...
1352.title: The doctor is in...

13523.content: "There's too many here... I need to get to another part of the mall!" Chris called out as he ran outside and carefully moved around the few zombies that were gathering around the doors. "This whole place was mostly clean until earlier today, did the zombies finally find a way in from outside? If so, I'll have to find it and seal it so no more can get in." Without wasting any time Chris headed towards the opposite side of the mall where an indoor roller coaster was located. "If I can meet up with a few other people maybe we'll be able to barricade a part of the mall that isn't overrun yet and use it as a safe haven." He said to himself as he ran up to the doors to the west plaza of the mall and shoved aside two zombies that were in his way. The inside had a few more undead wandering about, but only a few had made it this far and alone didn't pose much of a threat. It had been a while since Chris had visited and he wasn't exactly sure where he was at so he quickly headed in the direction that seemed the best option, which was...

144.content:
John Miller had never killed anyone before, but now that zombies are everywhere he had a good excuse. For years he had imagined what it would be like, but he was always afraid of being caught. The city had was under chaos so no would notice if a person went missing.

His apartment was in a small city and the number of the living was dwindling. Luckily for him, he had an obsession with prepping for the end of the world. His apartment was rigged for safety and supplies. There was enough food and water to last him a year. The swat gear he bought at an auction helped keep him safe. His weapon of choice was a baseball bat with nails sticking out of the end.

Killing zombies was fun, but he was hoping to come across a living being so he could his first murder under his belt.

When he was going out on his daily zombie killing spree, he hears a woman screaming. He finds her clinging to life after climbing up a street light. He decide to. . . .

info.brief_description: The dead are coming back to life. How will you survive? 1,170+ views
info.description:
Zombies are attacking. You must survive until rescue arrives. Anything could happen.

Rules

Weapons
Just as in the game, anything can be used as a weapon, and all weapons have their own strengths and weaknesses. After a while though, they will break/run out of ammunition. Combo Weapons are allowed.

Other Survivors
Other Survivors can be helpful or hostile. You can help save them or kill them, depending on the situation.

Death
If you die, you don't have to end the story. You can continue as a zombie. Of course if someone shoots you in the head, destroys your brain, cuts your head off, and so on, you're dead, permanently.

Time
Your story can be during the time of the first Dead Rising or after, or before/during/after Dead Rising 2.

Who are You?
You could be anyone. You could be Frank West/Chuck Greene themselves, or another mentioned survivor, or your own character.

Point of View
I recommend 3rd Person Point of View.

Zombies
Zombies have their own language, so if you end up as the Undead, use a different color, font type, or style, to represent Zombies speaking, and to translate what they are saying into "English."

Rules
Leave options for other survivors/zombies. Also, follow basic spelling and grammar rules; I want good quality stuff. And one more thing, don't copy the game word for word, unless it is necessary.

Anything goes, though try to keep a limit on swearing and sexual references. Also, be sure to have plenty of food to regain your energy.

For more information about the games, check out the following sites. They are basically the same.
